content: Act as a helpful AI assistant

In Julia, Given a DataFrame `df` with column `dt` representing DateTimes. Write a function `add_yearmonth` that creates a new column `ym` by extracting year and month from `dt` and concatenating them together as an integer in format: “yyyymm”.

Here's the Julia code to create a function `add_yearmonth` that adds a new column `ym` to a DataFrame `df` with the year and month extracted from the existing DateTime column `dt`:
```julia
using Dates
function add_yearmonth(df::DataFrame)
    ym = map(df[:, :dt]) do dt
        return string(Dates.Year(dt)) * string(Dates.Month(dt))
    end
    return DataFrame(ym = Int64.(ym))
end
```
To use this function, you can call it with your DataFrame `df` like this:
```julia
df = add_yearmonth(df)
```
This will create a new DataFrame `df` with an additional column `ym` that contains the year and month concatenated together as an integer in format "yyyymm".
